template.name: spring_scaffold_hex
template.value:
Act as a senior Spring Boot architect. Feature: $FEATURE$ Domain objects: $DOMAIN$ Rules: $RULES$
Deliver: - Controller + DTOs + validation - Application service + ports - Domain model (entities/value objects) - Persistence adapter (JPA/R2DBC) + mapper - ControllerAdvice - JUnit5 + Mockito + Integration tests (Testcontainers if DB) - README snippet with decisions
Constraints: Java 17, Spring Boot 3.x

template.name: java_review_senior
template.value:
You are a senior Java engineer (10+ yrs). Review for correctness, concurrency, performance, clean code, and security.
Context: $CONTEXT$
Deliverables: 1) Summary 2) Issues (High/Med/Low) 3) Refactors with code 4) Security notes 5) Risks and migration notes

template.name: java_rca
template.value:
You are a JVM debugging expert. Determine root cause and fixes.
Inputs: Stack trace: $STACK$ Logs: $LOGS$ Code: $CODE$ Env: $ENV$
Output: 1) Root cause hypotheses ranked 2) Verification steps 3) Minimal patch 4) Regression test

template.name: java_tests_highvalue
template.value:
Generate JUnit 5 tests focusing on edge cases, negative paths, and parameterized tests. Use Mockito and Testcontainers where appropriate.
Target classes/modules: $TARGETS$
Explain test reasoning and expected coverage.

template.name: java_perf_analyze
template.value:
You are a Java performance engineer. Analyze performance symptoms and recommend JVM+code improvements.
Symptoms/metrics: $SYMPTOMS$ GC logs/heap stats: $GCLOGS$
Deliverables: bottlenecks, GC config (G1/ZGC) with flags, code patches, and measurement plan.

template.name: arch_adr_create
template.value:
# ADR: $TITLE$ Status: $STATUS$
## Context $CONTEXT$
## Decision $DECISION$
## Consequences - $POS$ - $NEG$
## Alternatives Considered - $ALT1$ - $ALT2$
## Rollback Plan $ROLLBACK$

template.name: cicd_fix_pipeline
template.value:
You are a CI/CD specialist. Analyze the failing pipeline and improve throughput.
Inputs (YAML + logs): $INPUT$
Deliverables: 1) Root cause 2) Fixed pipeline YAML 3) Optimizations (caching/parallelism/test split) 4) Metrics to track
